text: The municipality is located in Krapina-Zagorje County in northern Croatia Budinščina is a village and municipality in the Krapina-Zagorje County in Croatia connected by the state road D24 and R201 railway. According to the 2001 census, there are 2,503 inhabitants in the area, absolute majority of which are Croats. Milengrad (Milen) castle is located in the municipality. ==Settlements== The following settlements comprise the municipality: * Budinšćina * Gotalovec * Grtovec * Krapinica * Marigutić * Pažurovec * Pece * Pokojec * Pomperovec * Prepuštovec * Sveti Križ * Topličica * Zajezda ==References== Category:Populated places in Krapina-Zagorje County Category:Municipalities of Croatia
title: Budinščina
